info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 7:51AM CDT until May 28 at 11:22AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County.
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River at Greenville.
* WHEN...From this morning to late Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur. A few rural roads closures will be needed along the river reach. Moderate flooding will occur along the river through Greenville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 17.1 feet this evening. It will then fall tomorrow morning. It will rise to 16.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING
